item.title: End of the Premises Contact Center
item.description: By: John Shepler Business telephone systems have evolved significantly. We’ve transitioned from single-line phones to switchboards, automated systems, and sophisticated call center PBXs. However, one thing remained constant: these systems were all located on-site. Whatâ€™s Wrong With Premises Equipment? Keeping everything in-house seems appealing because it gives you control over functionality, access, and services. You might even believe that in-house systems are more reliable than off-site solutions. On-premises systems offer visibility and control.
